newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine unions warns of another strike.
newsitem.headline: Argentine unions warns of another strike.

text.p: Argentina's CGT labor federation warned on Wednesday it may stage another 36-hour strike in addition to the one already announced for May if planned talks on labor reforms do not reach any conclusions, state-news agency Telam reported.
CGT head Rodolfo Daer made the warning after a meeting with leaders of trade unions late Wednesday, said Telam.
Daer said he wanted to reach agreement with the employers "but if that is not possible we will have to take the road of action."
Trade unions are set to meet with business employers next week.

Prior to Wednesday's CGT meeting there was speculation that the federation would announce the date of the previously announced 24-hour strike to be held in May. The 36-hour stoppage would be held in June, said Daer.
